employer.name: Statnett SF, Statnett
employer.description:
Vårt oppdrag er å sikre strømforsyningen i Norge døgnet rundt hele året. Det gjør vi ved å utvikle og drifte strømnettet slik at det møter alle krav fra samfunnet rundt oss. Vi leverer et robust og effektivt strømnett som er avgjørende for at vi når Norges klimamål, og bærekraftig verdiskaping for våre kunder og samfunnet.

Visjonen vår:
Statnett er sentral i den grønne omstillingen i dag og for kommende generasjoner. Sikker og robust strømforsyning skaper grobunn for gode liv og bærekraftig verdiskaping.

Våre verdier skal være rettesnor for våre handlinger, hvordan vi samarbeider og våre valg

  • Vi leverer effektivt på prioriterte oppgaver, med riktig tempo og kvalitet, og hele veien ut
  • Vi har mot til å prioritere og forenkle, til å gi tillit og til å tenke nytt
  • Vi gjør det sammen for effektiv samhandling, for å bygge relasjoner og deler

Hvorfor skal du velge å jobbe i Statnett?

  • Vi setter helse, miljø og sikkerhet foran alt
  • Vi forvalter landets viktigste infrastruktur
  • Vi er opptatt av å skape interne karriereveier og utvikle våre medarbeidere
  • Vi legger til rette for god balanse mellom jobb og fritid

Vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke, uavhengig av kjønn, kulturell bakgrunn, hull i CV-en eller funksjonsevne. 

Krav til søknaden din
Vi behandler kun søknader som registreres elektronisk med relevante vedlegg. Statnett forvalter kritisk infrastruktur og følger retningslinjer og lovpålagte sikkerhetskrav fra norske myndigheter i våre ansettelsesprosesser. Vi foretar bakgrunnssjekk med hjemmel i energiloven og følger sikkerhetskrav fra norske myndigheter ved ansettelse. Dersom stillingen krever sikkerhetsklarering etter sikkerhetsloven, må du være villig til å oppgi relevante opplysninger.

title: frontend-utvikler
description:
Om stillingen

Er du en erfaren programvareutvikler som søker en betydningsfull mulighet til å bidra i offentlig sektor? Vi i Digitaliseringsdirektoratet ser etter en dedikert senior frontend-utvikler som kan bli en del av vårt innovative team. 
 

I rollen som senior frontend-utvikler hos oss kan du for eksempel jobbe med team som Altinn Studio, som støtter selvbetjent utvikling i Altinn 3 – fra opprettelsen til konfigurasjon, utvikling av skjema, testing og produksjonssetting for tjenesteutviklere og tjenesteeiere; Tilgangsstyring og Kontroll, som håndterer tilgangsløsninger på Altinn-plattformene; og Data.altinn.no, som arbeider med å forenkle datadeling i sanntid mellom virksomheter. Disse teamene er bare noen eksempler på de mange spennende DevOps-teamene i vårt økosystem, hvor det er mange muligheter for å bidra til meningsfylte prosjekter som virkelig gjør en forskjell i samfunnet. 
 

Som senior frontend-utvikler vil du: 

  • Arbeide med nøkkelplattformer som Altinn, som er en samfunnskritisk løsning for offentlig og privat sektor i Norge 
  • Du får sjansen til å forme fremtiden og retningen for ditt produkt ved å engasjere deg i vårt tverrfaglige DevOps-team, som benytter en moderne, åpen kildekode-teknologistakk. Hos oss er deling og samarbeid på GitHub kjernen i vår utviklingskultur. 
  • Bruke en moderne teknologistakk som inkluderer ReactJS, TypeScript, og vårt eget felles designsystem (https://www.designsystemet.no/). 
  • Bidra i et miljø hvor innovasjon og samfunnspåvirkning står i fokus. 

Teknologier du vil jobbe med: 

  • ReactJS + TypeScript for frontend-utvikling. 
  • Tanstack/React Query for effektiv datahenting og caching. 
  • Axios for HTTP-forespørsler. 
  • Testing Library/Jest og Playwright for testing av kode. 
  • CSS-Modules og Yarn Workspaces for enkel håndtering av styling og prosjektstruktur. 

Vi ser etter deg som: 

Du må ha

  • Har bachelor- eller mastergrad i IT eller annen relevant utdanning. Relevant arbeidserfaring kan kompensere for utdanningskravet.  
  • Har 3+ års erfaring med front-end utvikling.  
  • Besitter avanserte kodingsferdigheter og forståelse for systemarkitektur. 
  • Har kunnskap om DevOps-praksis og erfaring med skyteknologier. 
  • Kan lede utviklingsarbeid, veilede mindre erfarne utviklere, og sikre kodekvalitet og skalerbarhet i systemer.  

I tillegg til teknisk kunnskap søker vi etter deg som: 

  • Har evnen og viljen til å lære, dele kunnskap og erfaring. 
  • Er villige til å ta initiativ der det trengs og ikke er redde for å ta i et tak. 
  • Har ønske om å forstå den større sammenhengen og bidra i faglige diskusjoner. 
  • Viser en positiv og samarbeidsorientert holdning. 
  • Har som mål å bidra med verdi til samfunnet. 

Sikkerhetsklarering

Stillingen krever at du kan autoriseres for BEGRENSET etter bestemmelsene i sikkerhetsloven. 


Vi tilbyr: 

  • Spennende faglige utviklingsmuligheter i et voksende fagmiljø. 
  • Fleksibel arbeidstid og en familievennlig personalpolitikk. 
  • Lønn som rådgiver eller seniorrådgiver
  • Et felt preget av høy utviklingstakt og et spennende samfunnsoppdrag.  
  • Et dynamisk miljø med en uformell tone og en sterk vilje til å skape noe sammen. 
  • Mulighet for to timer trening i arbeidstiden per uke for å støtte en sunn livsstil. 
  • Medlemskap i Statens pensjonskasse, som tilbyr en av de beste pensjonsordningene i landet og gode forsikringsordninger. 

Les mer om godene ved å jobbe i staten på Arbeidsgiverportalen.


Ønsker du å flytte til Brønnøysund?  

Flyttekostnader kan dekkes etter avtale. Ved flytting til Brønnøysund, kan husleie dekkes de første seks månedene etter jobbstart. Dette er skattepliktig inntekt. Les mer om dette og andre fordeler på vår nettside: Brønnøysund. https://www.digdir.no/digdir/jobb-i-bronnoysund/3165. 


Inkluderende arbeidsliv og mangfold

Vi har tro på at mangfold er en viktig byggestein i et godt, spennende og utviklende arbeidsmiljø, og vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke. Vi ønsker medarbeidere med ulike kompetanser, fagkombinasjoner, livserfaring og perspektiver for å bidra til enda bedre oppgaveløsning. Riktig kompetanse på rett sted er vår viktigste prioritering når vi rekrutterer, og vi vil legge til rette for at personer med nedsatt funksjonsevne også kan jobbe hos oss.

Vi oppfordrer søkere til å krysse av i jobbportalen dersom de har funksjonsnedsettelse, hull i CV-en eller innvandrerbakgrunn. Avkrysningene i jobbsøkerportalen danner grunnlag for anonymisert statistikk som alle statlige virksomheter rapporterer i sine årsrapporter. 

Dersom det er kvalifiserte søkere med funksjonsnedsettelse, hull i CV-en eller innvandrerbakgrunn, skal vi innkalle minst én søker i hver av disse gruppene til intervju. For å bli vurdert som søker i disse gruppene, det vil si positivt særbehandlet på denne måten, må søkerne oppfylle visse krav. Les mer om kravene på Arbeidsgiverportalen.


Vil du vite mer?

Synes du dette høres interessant ut og ønsker nærmere informasjon, kontakt gjerne:  

Seksjonssjef Roberto Andres Carrera  

E-post: roberto.andres.carrera@digdir.n

Telefon: 98606960  

Vitnemål og attester må følge søknaden. Vi ber om at du henter vitnemål fra Vitnemålsportalen direkte i Jobbnorge når du søker stillingen. Dersom du har tatt hele eller deler av utdanningen din i utlandet, ber vi om en autorisert oversettelse av papirer og vitnemål, og godkjenning fra NOKUT.

Søkerlister kan bli offentliggjort iht. offentleglova § 25. Dersom du ønsker å reservere deg fra oppføring på offentlig søkerliste, må dette begrunnes. Opplysninger kan bli offentliggjort selv om du har bedt om ikke å bli oppført på søkerlisten. Du vil i så fall bli varslet.

employer.name: Digitaliseringsdirektoratet
employer.description:
Digdir er underlagt Digitaliserings- og forvaltningsdepartementet. Direktoratet har om lag 380 ansatte fordelt på våre kontor i Brønnøysund, Leikanger og Oslo. Vi har fire fagavdelinger, tre stabs- og støtteavdelinger og et tilsyn for universell utforming av ikt, som har en særskilt uavhengig rolle. Våre verdier er pålitelig, inkluderende og uredd.

Direktoratet er regjeringens fremste verktøy for en raskere og mer samordnet digitalisering av offentlig sektor. Vi skal bidra til enklere og mer tilgjengelige offentlige tjenester for innbyggerne, og økt verdiskaping for næringslivet. Vår visjon er sammen for en enklere digital hverdag.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Shape the future of the Altinn Ecosystem with us 

If you're driven to contribute to a platform that serves as a foundation for innovation within the Altinn Ecosystem, your expertise and vision are what we need. Apply today to be part of our mission to enhance and expand digital public services in Norway. 

Your primary focus will be the Altinn Ecosystem, including Altinn Studio, Altinn Apps, Access Management and Control, data.altinn.no and much more. These teams are at the forefront of self-service development, access strategies, and real-time data sharing, providing a rich canvas for your skills. 

 In this pivotal role, you will: 

  • Lead and contribute to our internal platform, aiming to enhance the developer experience, reduce operational toil, and improve system reliability and observability. 
  • Collaborate with developers, internal users, and product owners, designing systems and capabilities that optimize the development and deployment process, ensuring our services meet the highest standards of reliability and user satisfaction. 
  • You will provide essential support to platform users, treating the platform itself as a product to maximize its utility and adoption, while actively collaborating with your team to address challenges, conceptualize designs, and craft innovative solutions. 

Why join us? 

At Digdir we are dedicated to enhancing and expanding the Altinn Ecosystem, a cornerstone of digital public services in Norway. Our goal is straightforward yet impactful: to develop an internal developer platform that propels our capabilities forward – for us and for our customers and partners. As a Senior Platform Engineer your role extends beyond coding; you're here to accelerate and glue our ambitions, focusing on the Altinn Ecosystem's growth and efficiency. 

  • You'll play a crucial role in shaping the Altinn Ecosystem, directly impacting how public digital services are created and delivered. 
  • Our culture is built on innovation, collaboration, and a shared commitment to excellence. We prioritize your growth and learning, offering opportunities for mentorship and professional development. 
  • By joining us, you become part of a team dedicated to making a difference in the way digital services are experienced, focusing on efficiency, reliability, and user satisfaction. 

We are seeking someone with: 

Must have:

  • Bachelor or Master degree in IT or other relevant education degrees. Relevant work experience can compensate for educational requirements  
  • 3-5+ years of experience in Platform Engineering, DevOps, or SRE roles, with a solid track record in Terraform, Grafana, Prometheus, AKS, Azure, Helm, Traefik Labs, Linkerd, Mimir, and containers (Docker, Kubernetes). 
  • A passion for building scalable services and a strong background in system architecture, advanced coding, and DevOps practices, including cloud technologies (particularly Azure). 
  • Experience in setting up and optimizing CI/CD pipelines to streamline development workflows and enhance automation. 
  • The ability to manage high-transaction environments, decompose services for optimal performance, and guide teams in rolling out new services efficiently. 
  • Good communication skills in English – Norwegian language is a plus.  

Bonus skills but not mandatory: 

  • A security first approach: Prioritizing security with experience in protocols, threat models, and secure coding to safeguard platform integrity. 
  • Disaster recovery and high availability: Designing strategies to guarantee continuous operations and minimal service interruptions. 
  • Programming languages, especially Go or Python, is prized. 

Security clearance requirement 

Candidates must be eligible for LIMITED clearance as per the Norwegian Security Act. For more details on the security clearance process and requirements, please visit NSM's official page on security clearance. 


Beyond technical expertise

At Digdir our strength lies not only in our technical capabilities but also in our team's diverse talents, perspectives, and the shared commitment to our mission. As we continue to evolve the Altinn Ecosystem, we're seeking individuals who bring more than just technical knowledge to the table: 


The qualities we value 

  • Eagerness to learn and share: You have an insatiable curiosity to acquire new knowledge and are just as eager to share insights and lessons with your teammates. 
  • Initiative and hands-on engagement: You do not wait for directions but proactively seek out areas where you can make an impact, demonstrating a readiness to dive into hands-on work whenever necessary. 
  • Broader perspective: Your interest goes beyond the confines of code. You seek to understand the wider context of your work, contributing meaningfully to professional discussions and decisions. 
  • Positive collaboration: You are known for your positive outlook and ability to work collaboratively, fostering an environment of support, innovation, and shared success. 
  • Societal impact: Your work is more than a job; it's a contribution to society. You're driven by the desire to make a difference, leveraging technology to improve public digital services. 

Why work at Digdir? 

We offer:  

  • Permanent position: Engage in a role as an advisor or senior advisor, with competitive terms according to Digdirs salary policy.  
  • Professional development: Embrace the opportunity for growth within your field.  
  • Work-life balance: Enjoy flexible working hours, family-friendly policies, and the possibility for physical activity during work hours.  
  • Benefit from membership in Statens pensjonskasse, offering excellent pension schemes, favorable home loans, and comprehensive insurance policies.  
  • Collaborative environment: Thrive in a workplace that values informal interaction, teamwork, and a shared ambition to achieve.  
  • Dynamic field: Engage with tasks in a rapidly evolving domain, driven by a significant social mission.  
  • Location: Our offices are situated in Oslo, Brønnøysund and Leikanger offering a unique blend of professional opportunity and lifestyle.  

Read more about the benefits of working in the public sector at Arbeidsgiverportalen.   
https://arbeidsgiver.dfo.no/lonn-goder-og-reise   


Do you want to move to Brønnøysund?  

Moving costs can be covered by agreement. When moving to Brønnøysund, rent can be covered for the first six months after starting the job. This is taxable income.   

Read more about this and other benefits on our website: https://www.digdir.no/digdir/jobb-i-bronnoysund/3165. 


Inclusive working life and diversity  

We champion diversity as a cornerstone of a vibrant work environment, urging all qualified candidates to apply. Our goal is to assemble a team with varied skills, experiences, and perspectives to enhance our problem-solving capabilities. We prioritize matching the right competencies to the right roles and are committed to facilitating employment for persons with disabilities.  


Contact us  

This position reports to Roberto Carrera, Head of Section Development.  

For more details about this position, please reach out to Roberto

email: roberto.andres.carrera@digdir.no 
phone +4798606960

Diplomas and certificates must accompany the application. We ask that you retrieve diplomas from the Diploma Portal directly in Jobbnorge when applying for the position. If you have taken all or part of your education abroad, we ask for an authorized translation of papers and diplomas, and approval from NOKUT.

employer.name: Digitaliseringsdirektoratet
employer.description:
Digdir operates under the The Ministry of Digitalisation and Public Governance (Norwegian: Digitaliserings- og forvaltningsdepartementet), with around 360 employees across offices in Brønnøysund, Leikanger, and more. Our organization includes four professional departments, three staff and support departments, and The Authority for Universal Design of ICT, which plays a unique role. Our core values are reliability, inclusivity, and courage.  

For more information, visit our website at Digdir.no.  

In compliance with the Public Administration Act § 25, candidate lists will be made public. Should you wish to remain off the public candidate list, justification is required. You will be notified if your information is to be made public despite such a request.

title: Backend Developer
description:
We're thrilled that you're considering a career at Kindly! Here's everything you need to know about this job. 🥳


🌟 What we want your help with:

  • You will be our fifth backend developer, and we want help to build stable services with good code. All our team members are senior developers, so we want you to learn from us, as well as bring new ideas and knowledge to the table.

  • We are building the world's most loved chatbot, using all the buzzwords (AI, LLM, ML, GPT-4, Gemini, etc).

  • We use AI both in the chatbot, but also on the platform side to help users build content.

  • We need you to bring your skills so we can keep building a product that competes at the top level against global competitors.

 

🌟 Some of our goals for the next 2 years

  • 200% increase in MAU in the chatbot Platform

  • 60% positive chatbot feedback from end users

  • Keep our position as the most user friendly Chat widget and Chatbot platform

  • Improve our Analytics and Insight tools to compete among the best

  • Reduce time spent on building bots by 60%

  • 35% of all chatbot sessions contain positive usage of an integration


🌟 Where we might stand out:

  • No tracking of hours (we believe in great work and trust)

  • Small team (16) with high output

  • Multiple deploys each day

  • 1-2 valuable features every week

  • Freedom and time to refactor and remove code debt

 

🌟 Some of our current stack:

  • Python with Django

  • NodeJs

  • React with Typescript

  • MongoDB

  • Postgresql

  • Elasticsearch

  • GCP

 

🟢 About Kindly:

Kindly is a growing SaaS company of 50+ employees, working out of Oslo, Stockholm, and Copenhagen. Our chatbot platform helps big businesses and organizations around the world to automate and deliver world-class customer service. We leverage AI, GPT and machine learning to build the world's most loved chatbot. We have over 140 incredible clients that include Elkjøp Nordic, Kahoot!, Voi, Norwegian and Happy Socks – just to name a few. Our tech reaches over one million users every month and we handle thousands of messages every hour.

 

🌟 What you will do:

As a Backend Developer on the Product team, your job will be to:

  • Research, develop, and improve.

  • Continuously improve the platform while looking out for new opportunities.

  • Be responsible for all the stages of the feature development cycle

  • Discuss ideas, design speccing, and workshopping

  • Complex problem-solving and coordination with other teams to deliver features

  • Release features to thousands of users

  • Freedom to work across the stack and have a lot of input on the areas you wish to focus on

  • Talk directly to customers (if you are comfortable with that)

 

🌟 Who we think you are:

  • 3-5+ years experience with backend development

  • Experience with either Python, Django, Nodejs, or Elixir

  • Experience with Postgresql, MongoDB, or other SQL/NoSQL databases

  • Commitment to the craft and the collaboration involved. Peer reviewing, and writing robust, reusable, and testable code.

  • Understanding of scalability and performance

  • Ability to lead or self-organize a project through the entire feature development life cycle

 

🌟 It’s a bonus if you have experience with:

  • DevOps

  • ElasticSearch

  • Kubernetes and Docker

  • CI/CD and automation

  • Terraform with a public cloud like AWS or GCP

  • High level knowledge of AI and ML

 

🌟 What we offer that might be more normal, but good to know:

  • Option to buy stocks at a discount

  • Modern offices at Grünerløkka, Oslo

  • All devs and designers are located in Oslo

  • Social stuff (parties, morning sauna, Friday beers, ping pong table, good vibes)

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • 2-day bi-monthly Hackathon during work hours

  • Personal development hours during work hours (10 hours /month)

 

More to tell, but let's do that if you find this interesting.

employer.name: Kindly
employer.description: Kindly is one of Europe’s leading chatbot providers specializing in the development of artificial intelligence and automation solutions for customer service and communication. The company offers a platform that combines advanced machine learning techniques and natural language processing (NLP) to enhance the customer experience and improve the efficiency of customer service processes.

title: Fullstack Developer (frontend focus)
description:
Are you a full-stack developer dreaming of building a global platform that enables mobile services for the car maintenance industry? 


Do you get excited with having a chance to re-define how car maintenance looks like? Do you believe that tomorrow’s winners will be those who can build and deliver the absolute best customer experiences? Are you motivated by solving a problem on an international level? Then you might be the person our team is looking for, where you will have the chance to solve big problems and help shape the future of our company. 


At Noddi, we are convinced that in the near future it will be unacceptable for all people who value their time to be forced to travel to a garage to have their car fixed, and that this way of working will hinder successful adoption of shared mobility concepts. Just as groceries, parcels and restaurants are now coming to your home, the same will be expected from the mechanics. And our team is on a mission to build and commercialize the next generation platform for service logistics and dispatch needed to deliver these services, seamlessly and cost-effectively. 


We are now looking for a full-stack developer to join us on this mission! Who are we looking for? 


We think you have some of these traits… 

High degree of engagement/enthusiasm: Our customers and technicians are the most important part of our business. To ensure that we have satisfied customers, we sometimes need to go out of our way to enable this experience. Are you someone that has the same burning desire? 

Comfortable working in a small team: This means a lot of flexibility and responsibility but on the other hand more is also expected from you. 

Continuous Learning: An eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving technical landscapes is key. We seek someone passionate about keeping up with web development trends and applying new knowledge to tackle real-world issues. 

Critical thinking - We are building something new, and there is no blueprint to follow. You should have opinions on architectural matters, be more than willing to advocate for these, and question our past and current design decisions. 


What technical qualifications and responsibilities do we think will help you succeed? 


We are now looking for a skilled Full-Stack Developer with a strong focus on front-end development, proficient in React and TypeScript, to join our innovative team at Noddi. The ideal candidate will possess a solid understanding of modern web development practices for creating user-centric applications. Below are technical qualifications and responsibilities for the role: 

● React + TypeScript: You should have a deep understanding of React.js and its core principles. Proficiency in TypeScript is essential for writing type-safe code and enhancing our application’s reliability and maintainability. 

● Django REST Framework: While not a prerequisite, familiarity with Django REST API for backend development will probably help you get up to speed faster. A willingness to learn and master Django is however important, as it’s part of our tech stack for designing API endpoints. 


About us: 

We are on a mission to move any type of car maintenance to your home or place of work. We have started with a car wash, tire hotel and wheel change service, where we have served close to 6000 cars. 

As a startup, we're a small but fast-moving team. With 75% of our founding team coming from Oda, we know a thing or two about building companies, both succeeding and failing. We're all about working together to build smart and scalable solutions that will make our customers' lives easier. 


What we can offer: 

A fast-paced work environment where you will get loads of responsibility. The tedious tasks we try and outsource - you will be working on the stuff that moves the needle. 

● Skin in the game: Be one of the owners of the company, we can offer an attractive options package as one of the early members of our team 

● Salary: Competitive salary 

● Offices: Central location at Skøyen in Oslo, but also flexible on working from external locations 

● Work/life balance: It’s often a cliché, but we need to live by it because our team today on average has 1.5 kids under the age of 10! We definitely value and respect work-life-balance. 

● Flexible working hours, and opportunity to work remotely 

● 25 vacation days per year 


The application process will look something like this:

We are looking to fill this position as soon as possible.

Step 1: Quick screening call to check if we are a match on the basics. 

Step 2: Meet with one or two people from our founding team so we can all get to know each other better. 

Step 3: Meet with our CTO to go a bit deeper into your understanding of tech and how we work with tech. 

The process should not take more than 2-3 weeks. 

We are very much looking forward to hearing from you!

employer.name: Noddi
employer.description: Noddi is a disruptor within automotive maintenance and enables convenient & cost efficient home-delivered car maintenance though modern UX and logistics technology. Our focus on awesome booking experiences, and logistics automation enable us to deliver car maintenance services such as wheel change and car detailing directly to your home at the same prices you have to pay in a traditional garage.

title: .NET Utvikler søkes til et selskap i vekst
description:
Senior .NET-utvikler hos Glasspaper Solutions

Om Glasspaper Solutions:

Glasspaper Solutions er et ledende teknologiselskap som tilbyr skreddersydde løsninger og konsulenttjenester innen Front-end, Back-end utvikling og UI/UX-design. Vi er kjent for vår dedikasjon til kvalitet, innovasjon og tett samarbeid med våre kunder for å levere resultater av høyeste standard. Hos oss er alle i samme båt, og alle er utviklere. Vår daglige leder, Lasse, er også først og fremst en utvikler.

Om rollen:

Vi søker en erfaren Senior .NET-utvikler med en lidenskap for å skape robuste og skalerbare løsninger. Du vil være en sentral aktør i vårt team i Oslo-området og bidra til å forme og implementere innovative teknologiløsninger som oppfyller våre kunders behov og forventninger.

Ansvarsområder:

  • Utvikle høykvalitets, effektive .NET-baserte løsninger med fokus på ytelse og skalerbarhet
  • Samarbeide tett med våre Front-end og UI/UX-team for å integrere bakre ender sømløst
  • Delta aktivt i alle faser av utviklingsprosessen, fra planlegging og design til implementering og vedlikehold
  • Tilby teknisk veiledning og mentorering til juniorutviklere
  • Utforske og implementere nye teknologier og beste praksiser for å forbedre produktkvalitet og effektivitet

Hva vi tilbyr:

  • Et inspirerende og støttende arbeidsmiljø med fokus på kontinuerlig læring og personlig utvikling. Med Glasspaper i ryggen tilbyr vi landets beste tilbud på kompetanseutvikling!
  • Konkurransedyktig lønn og gode fordeler, inkludert fleksibel arbeidstid, velg det utstyret du trenger, mye sosiale alternativer som CS-bedriftslag, spillkvelder og mere.
  • Muligheten til å jobbe med cutting-edge teknologier og spennende prosjekter for noen av Norges ledende selskaper
  • En dedikert og engasjert team av profesjonelle som deler din lidenskap for teknologi og innovasjon

Kvalifikasjoner:

  • Hyggelig, og vil andre godt.
  • Minimum 5 års erfaring med .NET-utvikling, med solid kunnskap om C#, ASP.NET eller andre relaterte teknologier
  • Erfaring med Azure-plattformen og integrasjonsteknologier er en fordel
  • Sterke analytiske ferdigheter og evnen til å løse komplekse problemer
  • Gode kommunikasjonsevner og evnen til å jobbe effektivt både selvstendig og som en del av et team

Prosessen:

  • En remote introduksjon
  • En uformell kaffeprat på kontoret
  • Et teknisk møte
  • Tilbud

Glasspaper Solutions ble stiftet i 2017 og er en del av Glasspaper-familien. Selskapet består av utviklere som er opptatt av å bygge samfunnsnyttige og smarte løsninger. Hvis du er en lidenskapelig og engasjert utvikler som ønsker å være en del av et dynamisk og innovativt team, ser vi frem til å høre fra deg!

Send CV til oss i dag for å utforske mulighetene hos Glasspaper Solutions - Application@yourheadway.no.

employer.name: Glasspaper Solutions AS
employer.description: Glasspaper Solutions leverer konsulenttjenester og digitale løsninger til store og små bedrifter. Glasspaper Solutions ble stiftet i 2017 og er en del av Glasspaper-familien. Selskapet består av utviklere som er opptatt av å bygge samfunnsnyttige og smarte løsninger. Hvis du er en lidenskapelig og engasjert utvikler som ønsker å være en del av et dynamisk og innovativt team, ser vi frem til å høre fra deg!

title: Tech Lead
description:
Hey there!🌞

Do you want to contribute to a cleaner planet?

Skyfri Technologies AS is a  global and fast-growing clean technology company based in Oslo. Our advanced proprietary technology, powered by machine learning and big data, will completely digitize the way asset owners operate their power plants, and help them improve uptime and production.

Our vision is to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy globally and we believe that software will be the engine to achieve that goal.


What you’ll be doing

As a Technical Lead at Skyfri, you will play a pivotal role in leading and guiding a team of software engineers to deliver high-quality and innovative software solutions. You will be responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of projects, providing technical direction, and ensuring the successful execution of software development initiatives.


In this role, you will

  • Provide technical leadership and mentorship to a team of software engineers.

  • Set and enforce coding standards, best practices, and development methodologies.

  • Collaborate with other stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables.

  • Break down project requirements into tasks and allocate them appropriately among the team.

  • Lead the design and architecture of software solutions, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and performance.

  • Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to design principles and coding standards.

  • Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices.

  • Provide guidance on the selection of appropriate technologies for projects.

  • Address technical challenges and provide solutions in a timely manner.

  • Act as a point of escalation for technical issues within the team.

  • Ensure the delivery of high-quality software through rigorous testing and code reviews.

  • Implement and improve automated testing processes.


You are…

… Smart and ambitious, with a passion for start-ups and clean tech. You are creative, always willing to break new ground and come up with new and exciting ideas. You are open-minded, kind, and a team player who understands that we are all in this together.


In addition, we need you to:

  • Be fluent in English, our working language.

  • Live in or in commuting distance to Oslo, Norway.

  • Have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Work experience of a similar nature may be considered in place of the specified qualifications.

  • 6+ years of experience as a software developer, with a strong background in software architecture.

  • Strong background working with Azure services such as Azure Functions, Azure App Service, and Azure SQL Database.

  • Proficiency in React and JavaScript.

  • Expertise in C# and .NET development for building scalable and maintainable back-end systems.

  • Familiarity with version control systems, continuous integration, and deployment pipelines.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


What we offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

  • Flexible working hours with work-from-home days.

  • Interesting work within a dynamic and innovative company.

  • A central role in a company in high growth, with great opportunities for career and personal development.

  • A lot of fun in an international and diverse office environment.

 

At Skyfri, we embrace diversity as the cornerstone of who we are. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic. We choose our candidates based only on qualifications, merit and business need.


We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Software Engineer - Lead, Innovate, & Transform with Us! 🚚
description:
🚀 Join Zendera: Transform Logistics & Drive Sustainability 🌍

The Opportunity:

Did you know that nearly 30% of road freight in Norway operates with empty trucks? Or that only 54% of consumer deliveries succeed on the first attempt in the EU? At Zendera, we're combating these inefficiencies head-on.

Who We Are:

Zendera is at the forefront of reimagining logistics. Our platform optimises order management, gives real-time transport visibility, streamlines routes, and puts track-and-trace power in the hands of end customers. Empowering drivers, reducing waste, and elevating the e-commerce experience, we are on a mission to redefine the logistics landscape.

Who You Are:

A Senior Developer not just in title but in mindset. You have:

  • 3+ years developer experience 

  • You're willing to get your hands dirty and spend much of your time coding

  • A history of collaboration, learning, and solution-seeking.

  • Proficiency in Go, PostgreSQL, and frameworks like Angular.

  • Experience with cloud development: GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc. a bonus

  • Leadership experience? That's a plus!

Why Zendera:

  • Competitive salary and ownership through share options.

  • Essential tech gear + mobile subscription.

  • 5 weeks of vacation + flexible hours.

  • Relax in our sauna at the Oslo fjord.

  • Work from our centrally-located Storgata, Oslo office.

Your Journey with Us in Recruitment:

  • A digital chat with our hiring manager, the CPTO.

  • Code test + Case study resulting in an interview with our product development team.

  • Connect with our CEO and Customer Success to align on vision and values.

Zendera has been on an explosive growth trajectory since 2022. Be part of the force that's pushing the envelope, shaping the future of logistics, and driving our world towards sustainability.

📩 Ready to make an impact? Let's reshape logistics together!

employer.name: Zendera AS
employer.description: Zendera is an award-winning management system for small and medium-sized transportation companies. The system solves complex logistical challenges and helps carriers use their resources efficiently and sustainably. A positive investment for the carrier and the environment.The transportation industry is one of the pillars of our society, but the industry is characterized by low efficiency, poor customer experiences and considerable emissions. Our product has thus been met with great enthusiasm.

title: Software Engineer
description:
🚀 Plaace (/pleɪs/) is a rapidly growing Norwegian tech startup on a mission to create vibrant streets and cities that people truly love. We do so with a platform fuelled by state-of-the-art analytics and newly available data sources to enable smarter decisions for every actor wanting to understand the physical world.

We work with some of the largest property companies, retailers and brokers including OBOS, Eiendomsspar, Stor-Oslo Eiendom, Norgesgruppen, CBRE, Princess, Fretex, etc.

 

As our new software engineer, you will take a central role in within tech in our Oslo office collaborating among cross-functional team in Oslo, and a remote development team working to turn the Plaace vision into a great product. See what we’ve been working on recently. What you will do

  • Work in a cross-functional product team together with a remote development team to develop the Plaace platform, from understanding user needs to shipping and maintaining elegant code

  • Deliver great and consistent customer value by developing and maintaining software solutions and functionality

  • Work as a backend, frontend or a full stack engineer, either as an expert, or contribute broadly on the whole product

  • Own what you make and choose the tools and technologies you want to work with

  • Take ownership of technical challenges and strongly influence how they are solved

  • Use your experience to improve how we work, whether that is clean code, CI/CD, unit testing, code reviews, design system, agile principles or other topics you are passionate about

 

How we work

  • OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) for company and team goals, and 2 week sprints according to agile principles

  • Long term product vision and 3-12 months product roadmap that we iterate on based on learnings along the way

  • Customer driven, with high frequency touch points through user tests, workshops and customer pilot programs

  • Some of the technologies and tools we currently use: Typescript, React.js, Next.js and Node.js, Postgresql with PostGIS queries, Python (for data science mostly), Git and Github actions, AWS and GCP, Notion, Slack

 

We believe this is for you if…

  • You have worked 2-5 years in multidisciplinary product teams

  • You are passionate about making awesome clean and modifiable code

  • You’re self-driven with a proven ability to structure work and produce high-quality deliverables

  • You look for ways to learn new things and improve your skill set, and bring that back to the team and product

  • You have experience with several aspects of the software development cycle, like prototyping ideas, architecture definition, design system, scoping, documentation, delivery at scale, maintenance, build processes, testing routines, etc

  • You hold a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline with strong academic results, alternatively compensated by highly relevant work experience

  • You have experience with the Plaace technology stack, and experience with Python, Docker, PostgreSQL with PostGIS, and AWS/Google cloud is an advantage

  • You like collaborating with team members from other fields of expertise and are motivated to make a kick ass product together

 

What we offer

A unique opportunity to shape your own career and influence the growth of a successful start-up. Key benefits:

  • Get a ton of responsibility and freedom to contribute with your unique talent and experience while you work on truly enjoyable tasks and projects

  • See contributions be instantly implemented and create value

  • Contribute early in defining the next part of the growth journey for a VC-backed tech startup

  • Work closely with some of the biggest real estate companies in Norway, their retail and hospitality tenants, leading brokers, data partners and stars of the startup ecosystem

  • Work in a fun and inspiring culture that puts methods and learning at the center, in a team with experience from digital product development, data science, start-up, and venture capital

  • We will also support you in developing your skills and grow towards a tech lead role if that is what you strive for

  • 5 weeks vacation, social offices at StartupLab in Oslo (new friendships guaranteed), laptop and equipment of your choice, private health insurance, and an invite to the Plaace dinner club

employer.name: Plaace
employer.description:
🚀 Plaace (/pleɪs/) is a rapidly growing Norwegian tech startup on a mission to create vibrant streets and cities that people truly love. We do so with a platform fuelled by state-of-the-art analytics and newly available data sources to enable smarter decisions for every actor involved in the city floor. Our data-driven platform provides valuable insights and recommendations based on card transactions, footfall, demographics, and competition to empower businesses and organisations to make informed decisions.

We work with some of the largest property companies, retailers and brokers including OBOS, Eiendomsspar, Alti Forvaltning, Stor-Oslo Eiendom, Norgesgruppen, CBRE, Princess, Fretex, etc. We’re at a stage where we focus on growing the customer list and harvesting the market potential both nationally and internationally.

At Plaace you’ll join a high-paced environment in a rapidly growing startup. We work from a a kick-ass office environment at coworking space StartupLab, surrounded by other cool startups, and a convenient easy (5 mins) train access from the city center of Oslo.

We work in a fun and inspiring culture where you’ll get a ton of responsibility and freedom to contribute with your talent and experience. We benefit from high flexibility, where everyone is free to work from home a couple of times/week, but not fully remote, as we reap the high benefits of bringing our bright and diverse minds together. 

You will join a team of smart, talented and committed colleagues from a variety of backgrounds, both culturally and academically. Because we are a small team and work closely together, we also enjoy a lots of social activities, Friday beers, social dinners and company trips.

If this sounds like the right place for you, then we would love to hear from you. Check out our job openings below!

title: Erfarne Power Plattform konsulenter
description:
Med mange aktive konsulenter er vår kunde et av Norges ledende miljøer innen Power Platform. Nå skal teamet utvides!  
Vår kunde er et verdibasert konsulentselskap, med delingskultur, jordnærhet, entusiasme, troverdighet, og frihet som sentrale verdier. Vi leter etter dedikerte Power Platform-entusiaster som ønsker å være med å jobbe på prosjekter for å bygge fremtidens samfunn.

Dine ansvarsområder inkluderer:

Å bidra i krysningspunktet mellom utvikling og rådgivning.
Planlegge, utvikle og implementere nye løsninger.
Videreutvikle eksisterende løsninger.
Være en støttespiller for kundene, gi gode råd om plattformen, og følge med på utviklingen innenfor Power Platform.
Ønskede kvalifikasjoner:

Gode tekniske ferdigheter i Power Platform.
Evne til å utvikle brukerorienterte løsninger i skjæringspunktet mellom teknologi og forretning.
Nysgjerrighet på ny teknologi og god systemforståelse.
Ønske om å bidra i et fagmiljø og dele kunnskap med andre.
Kjennskap til Microsoft 365 og/eller Dynamics 365.
IT-relatert universitets- eller høyskoleutdannelse eller relevant erfaring.

Vi tilbyr: 
Personlig utviklingsplan: Vi tilbyr skreddersydde utviklingsplaner med nøye oppfølging, som gir deg muligheten til å utforske ulike fagområder, bransjer og roller.
Faglig utfordrende oppgaver: Du vil bli tildelt oppgaver som utfordrer dine faglige ferdigheter, med prosjekter som ofte har innvirkning langt utover oppdragsgiverens behov.
Work-life balance: Vi verdsetter livet utenfor arbeidsplassen. Frihet og fritid er sentrale verdier hos oss, og vi legger til rette for at du kan tilpasse hverdagen din etter dine behov.
Bonusordning og sikkerhet: Alle ansatte får del i bonuser. Vi gir deg økonomisk trygghet gjennom fast lønn og deltakelse i overskuddsdeling (bonusordning). I tillegg kompenseres det selvfølgelig for overtid i perioder hvor innsatsen din kreves litt ekstra.
 
Hvis denne beskrivelsen passer for deg, send oss gjerne din søknad og CV.
Etter ansettelse gjennomføres en tredjeparts bakgrunnssjekk etter søkerens samtykke, for å verifisere opplysningene gitt i rekrutteringsprosessen.

Vil du høre mer om muligheten, ta kontakt med Espen Hedley Nilsen på espenhn@veksthusetpersonal.no, eller ring +47 96 85 37 70 for en hyggelig samtale.

Vi ser frem til å motta og vurdere din søknad!

employer.name: Veksthuset Personal AS
employer.description:
Veksthuset Personal er et personalselskap med ekspertise innen rekruttering, bemanning, HR rådgivning og offshore.

Våre spesialiserte og erfarne rådgivere styrker kundenes verdiskaping gjennom våre tjenester, samtidig som vi bidrar til å sikre en meningsfull arbeidshverdag for arbeidstakerne vi formidler.

Våre tjenester leveres alltid i tråd med våre verdier: Effektive – Pålitelige – Menneskeorienterte – Innovative

title: Erfarne .NET-utviklere søkes til spennende prosjekter hos kunde
description:
Erfarne .NET-utviklere søkes til spennende prosjekter hos kunde

Vi er på jakt etter dyktige .NET-utviklere som ønsker å være en del av vårt dedikerte team og bidra til digitalisering og skybaserte løsninger for en av Norges største kunder. Her får du muligheten til å jobbe i et av landets mest omfattende .NET-miljøer med korte beslutningslinjer.

Om oss:

Vi tilbyr et av Norges beste fagmiljøer med en arbeidsgiver som kontinuerlig arbeider for å skaffe spennende prosjekter innen privat og offentlig sektor. Hos oss får du et stimulerende arbeidsmiljø med fokus på kompetansebygging, støttende samarbeid og sosiale aktiviteter. Vi legger vekt på varierte arbeidsoppgaver og gir deg gode muligheter for faglig utvikling. Du vil også ha sjansen til å eie en del av bedriften gjennom vårt aksjeprogram.

Vi tilbyr:

  • Et av Norges beste fagmiljøer innen .NET-utvikling
  • Spennende kunder og prosjekter i privat og offentlig sektor
  • Et positivt arbeidsmiljø med fokus på kompetansebygging og sosiale aktiviteter
  • Varierte arbeidsoppgaver med utfordrende prosjekter
  • Gode muligheter for faglig utvikling, støttende samarbeid og kompetansedeling
  • Eierskapsmuligheter gjennom aksjeprogram
  • Konkurransedyktige betingelser med attraktiv overskuddsdeling

Krav til deg:

Vi søker deg med minimum 3 års relevant erfaring og solid kompetanse innen:

  • .NET-utvikling (C#) - frontend/backend eller fullstack-utvikling fra flere prosjekter
  • Moderne web-teknologi og klientrammeverk
  • Databasesystemer (for eksempel: MS SQL Server)
  • Smidig utviklingsmetodikk som Scrum eller Kanban

Det er en fordel om du har kjennskap til eller ønske om å mestre:

  • Design Patterns
  • Docker, Kubernetes og andre systemer og verktøy for containerisering
  • Strukturert programmering, TDD, og DDD
  • Skyløsninger - primært Microsoft Azure

Hvem vi ser etter:

Vi søker deg som trives med å forstå "hele bildet" i komplekse løsninger, som forstår kundens behov og som ønsker å jobbe med store kunder og prestisjetunge Microsoft-prosjekter. Du skal kunne designe gode løsninger, utvikle sikre web- og klientapplikasjoner, og foretrekker å jobbe i et tverrfaglig team.

Søknader behandles fortløpende, og vi ser frem til å lese din! For spørsmål om stillingen, ta kontakt med Espen Hedley Nilsen på espenhn@veksthusetpersonal.no, eller ring +47 96 85 37 70 for en hyggelig prat.

Vi verdsetter mangfold og oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke, uavhengig av kjønn, alder, funksjonsevne, nasjonalitet eller bakgrunn.

title: Senior Solution Engineer
description:
Are you ready to tackle complex business challenges, lead full-stack initiatives, and revolutionize the pace of development—all without writing a single line of code?

Appfarm is challenging the principles of how great software should be made and delivers tailored digital services to businesses using in-house developed technology. Our innovative product, Appfarm Create, enables the development of advanced software with tailored functionality without a single line of code, and only with the help of a web browser.

We’re always on the lookout for experienced professionals in the field of no-code/low-code to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about leveraging innovative technology, working in a collaborating environment with a flat structure, and having a lot of fun along the way, Appfarm could be the perfect fit for you!

In the role as Senior Solution Engineer, you’ll play a crucial part in building cutting-edge digital solutions for our clients and be part of growing our expert environment in no-code development from idea to implementation together with our customers and partners.

 

What can we offer you?

  • A unique opportunity for a vital role in a tech scale-up.

  • A company seeking to create the next big thing in software, and enthusiastic colleagues with the ability to execute.

  • Competitive compensation and stock option plan.

  • Opportunities for accelerated career progression and management responsibilities.

  • Offices at Rebel – the new center of excellence for tech in Norway, with the best employee restaurant in Oslo.


Your main task and areas of responsibility will be:

  • Developing complete web and mobile applications using Appfarm Create, including design and implementation of conceptual, logical and data level.

  • Prototyping and experimental development with “fuzzy” specifications.

  • Actively work with our customers, partners and suppliers.

  • Be a key person in growing our company both professionally and socially to become one of Norway’s most exciting workplaces.

  • Contribute to strategic work related to technology, products, and marketing.


To succeed in this role, we believe:

  • You have 3+ years of experience with no-code/low-code development.

  • You are a problem solver who sees the whole picture, but also understands that great solutions depend on small details.

  • You have the ability to quickly grasp commercial aspects and end-users’ challenges and can translate this into abstract models of reality.

  • You have an analytical mindset, master logical thinking, and have insight into the principles of software development. Having programming experience is an advantage.

  • You are comfortable working without crystal clear specifications and understand that successful digital solutions are ultimately defined by the end user experience.

  • You are focused on execution and driven by creating results in cooperation with a team of ambitious colleagues.

  • You live in Norway/Østlandet or are planning to relocate here.

  • You have strong skills in English and can communicate in a Scandinavian language.


To develop innovative technology, you need a diverse and multidisciplinary team with different backgrounds and experience. If you want to be part of an adventure building Appfarm to the next level, we look forward to receiving your application, including a short motivational cover letter focusing on why you want to work with us. In addition, please attach a short resume preferably with examples on previous work experiences/projects and relevant academic results.

Any questions? Please contact Malin Haglund (Talent Manager) at below email.

employer.name: Appfarm
employer.description:
At Appfarm, our mission is to enable anyone to build exceptional digital solutions as fast and hassle-free as possible. We have commercialized a unique cloud-based development platform where you create, launch and manage business software 10x faster than previously possible, without using a single line of code. With drag & drop components and one-click deploy in the cloud, creating powerful digital experiences for web, tablet and mobile devices has never been easier.

We are a diverse and multidisciplinary team of around 40 employees with a passion for no-code and changing the nature of digital transformation, but we're growing quickly.  Our offices are located at Rebel, the new center of excellence for tech in Norway, with the best employee restaurant in Oslo.  

Working at Appfarm comes with the following four things:

💟 A healthy and happy work environment where everyone is respected, welcomed and included. We encourage knowledge sharing between departments, and have monthly events where we get the possibility to learn from and praise each others work. 

🚀 Career development. We do everything we can to ensure the happiness and professional growth of our employees. We are still a small company that is quickly developing, meaning that there is a lot of room for you to shape your own career by taking on responsibilities in areas that you are interested in.

🎉 A lot of social events where we get to do fun things together! We have  four major annual events (summer party, christmas table, cabin trip, and trip abroad), but we also do smaller things in between.

↔️ Flexibility. We believe that our employees know best when and in what surroundings they are most productive, and trust that the work get done without micromanaging your schedule. We are also firm believers in putting family before work when needed, and generally avoid scheduling meetings outside our core business hours between 9-15.

title: Application Operations Engineer
description:
Vil du være med og ta ansvar for tilgjengeligheten til IT systemer i et nordisk perspektiv? Statnett har en ledende rolle i etableringen av IT løsninger for balansering, automatisering av systemdriften og effektiv utnyttelse av det nordiske kraftsystemet. Det etableres både nordiske og nasjonale tidskritiske systemer med høye krav til tilgjengelighet. 

Seksjonen for applikasjonsdrift av driftskritiske tjenester har i dag syv ansatte. Seksjonen har ansvaret for høy tilgjengelighet for en bred portefølje av applikasjoner for å understøtte Statnetts kjerneoppgaver. Markedssystemer er en sentral del av denne porteføljen. Vårt arbeid er avgjørende for at det er strøm i alle hjem.  

Vi skal nå ansette en Application Operations Engineer til å styrke vår seksjon innenfor drift av de nye systemene for balansering av det norske og nordiske kraftsystemet. Du vil få en sentral rolle i grensesnittet mellom drift og utvikling, for å ivareta kravene til funksjonaliteten og sikre gode prosesser som understøtter dette arbeidet. Du vil bli en del av teamet som har operasjonelt ansvar for tilgjengeligheten til systemene. Du vil også følge opp og utvikle forholdet til våre samarbeidspartnere internt i Statnett, nasjonalt og internasjonalt.  

Vi tror du er selvstendig og løsningsorientert, og evner å kommunisere godt både internt og eksternt. Du er teamorientert og sikrer godt samarbeid på tvers i seksjonen. Du evner å sette deg inn i forretningens verdikjede og hvordan IT systemene understøtter prosessene. Rollen innebærer at du har forståelse for nye teknologiske plattformer, både on-premise og cloud. Samtidig som du har kompetanse på hvordan moderne deploy og bruk av støtteverktøy anvendes.  

Arbeidssted kan være på ett av våre kontorer; Oslo, Sandnes, Sunndalsøra, Trondheim eller Alta. 

 


Arbeidsoppgaver

  • Applikasjonsdrift av Java applikasjoner i et Linux miljø 
  • Incident og problem management 
  • Kontinuerlig forbedring av monitorering (Splunk og Grafana) 
  • Sikre meldingsflyt i systemlandskapet 
  • Konfigurasjonsstyring og automatisering 
  • Kvalitetssikre systemer for optimalisering av drift i samarbeid med utviklingssteamene
  • Stillingen kan inngå i 24/7 vaktordning 

Kvalifikasjoner

  • Utdanning innenfor IT fra høyskole eller universitet, lang erfaring kan kompensere for manglende formell utdannelse  
  • Minst 3 års erfaring fra drift eller utvikling av driftskritiske applikasjoner  
  • Erfaring eller kjennskap til drift av OpenShift/Kubernetes og Kafka er ønskelig  
  • Gode språkferdigheter på norsk og engelsk, både skriftlig og muntlig
  • Stillingen stiller krav til sikkerhetsklarering

Stillingen kan medføre deltakelse i vaktordning (on-call), dette godtgjøres i tilfelle særskilt.

Personlige egenskaper

Vi tror du er flink til å lære raskt og ser helheten i situasjoner. Når det blir hektisk, jobber du hardt og finner konstruktive løsninger. Du er klar over hva du er god på og hvor du kan bli bedre, og du lærer av både egne erfaringer og tilbakemeldinger fra andre. Folk stoler på deg fordi du er pålitelig, og du takler utfordringer på en overbevisende måte.

Vi tilbyr

Du vil være omgitt av kolleger med mye kompetanse som de gjerne vil dele med deg. Hos Statnett vil du få en konkurransedyktig lønn. Det er muligheter for hjemmekontor og i Statnett har vi fleksitid. Det er gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger, samt en bedriftshelsetjeneste. Det vil være flere anledninger til å være sosial med dine kollegaer, enten det måtte være bedriftsidrettslag, kor eller revy. Statnett har treningsstudio i sine lokaler og flere firmahytter det er mulig å låne.

Vi vil sørge for tilrettelegging på arbeidsplassen ved behov, f.eks. tilbud om språkopplæring.

Kontaktinformasjon

Kristian Ekrheim, +4790176602

Arbeidssted

Referansenr.: 4741311843
Stillingsprosent: 100%
Fast
Søknadsfrist: 16.04.2024

employer.name: Markedssystemer applikasjonsdrift, Statnett
employer.description:
Vårt oppdrag er å sikre strømforsyningen i Norge døgnet rundt hele året. Det gjør vi ved å utvikle og drifte strømnettet slik at det møter alle krav fra samfunnet rundt oss. Vi leverer et robust og effektivt strømnett som er avgjørende for at vi når Norges klimamål, og bærekraftig verdiskapning for våre kunder og samfunnet.

Visjonen vår:
Statnett er sentral i den grønne omstillingen i dag og for kommende generasjoner. Sikker og robust strømforsyning skaper grobunn for gode liv og bærekraftig verdiskaping

Våre verdier skal være rettesnor for våre handlinger, hvordan vi samarbeider og våre valg

  • Vi leverer effektivt på prioriterte oppgaver, med riktig tempo og kvalitet, og hele veien ut
  • Vi har mot til å prioritere og forenkle, til å gi tillit og til å tenke nytt
  • Vi gjør det sammen for effektiv samhandling, for å bygge relasjoner og deler

Hvorfor skal du velge å jobbe i Statnett?

  • Vi setter helse, miljø og sikkerhet foran alt
  • Vi forvalter landets viktigste infrastruktur
  • Vi er opptatt av å skape interne karriereveier og utvikle våre medarbeidere
  • Vi legger til rette for god balanse mellom jobb og fritid

Vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke, uavhengig av kjønn, kulturell bakgrunn, hull i CV-en eller funksjonsevne. 

Krav til søknaden din
Vi behandler kun søknader som registreres elektronisk med relevante vedlegg. Statnett forvalter kritisk infrastruktur og følger retningslinjer og lovpålagte sikkerhetskrav fra norske myndigheter i våre ansettelsesprosesser. Vi foretar bakgrunnssjekk med hjemmel i energiloven og følger sikkerhetskrav fra norske myndigheter ved ansettelse. Dersom stillingen krever sikkerhetsklarering etter sikkerhetsloven, må du være villig til å oppgi relevante opplysninger.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Spoor is a growing startup with a vision to enable nature and industry coexist. Recognising the environmental challenges of wind farms, we specialise in cutting-edge environmental impact assessments and continuous monitoring. Leveraging modern technology, including computer vision and AI, we optimize cost, accuracy, and efficiency.

At Spoor, we are committed to fostering a workplace that values diversity, inclusivity and accessibility. We are proud of our diverse team that consists of 12 nationalities. We strive to create an inclusive environment where every voice is heard, individuals feel valued and can bring their authentic selves to work. We believe that a diverse team is a key for creativity, problem-solving, and success. We wholeheartedly welcome everyone that is passionate to join our mission!


Description of the role

As a software engineer at Spoor every day you will be building bird detection and analysis software to process terabytes of videos. The tech-team at Spoor is small, so you can easily be involved in more than building software. This could be for example building data pipelines, training machine learning models, designing product solutions, building network infrastructure, troubleshooting system failures and much more. Our team works closely together to deliver their objectives timely. Entering our team ensures there will always be something relevant to do, no week will be the same and you will learn something every week!


Your work might include the following:

  • Developing and maintaining our video processing software

  • Building robust data pipelines

  • Building and maintaining serving infrastructure

  • Monitor the performance of our systems

  • Working with terabytes of labeled and unlabelled video data, for example analyzing and building models

  • Ensure uptime and functioning of IP cameras and computing equipment at remote locations


Must have 🚀

  • At least 2 years work experience with developing software in Python


Maybe you also have something from these? 🦉

  • Experience working with cloud computing platforms (for example AWS, Google Cloud or Azure)

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

  • Experience in computer vision

  • Experience building and operating reliable distributed systems in the cloud and on the edge

  • Experience with computer networking

  • Experience in AI frameworks like Tensorflow or PyTorch

  • Experience in TypeScript


What we offer

  • Flexibility. We offer a flexible working environment with freedom to tailor your work situation and hours to suit your life situation.

  • A market-related salary package

  • Employee equity in the company

  • A high quality of life and security in beautiful Norway

  • An opportunity to grow and learn as a professional and as a person

  • A diverse and inclusive workplace and an opportunity to make a difference

  • Accessibility to our office floor with an elevator

  • Work in a world-class team with exceptional talent on important problems

employer.name: Spoor
employer.description:
Our vision is to help industry and nature to coexist. 🦅

With the current pressure on nature, biodiversity management is bound to see a new wave of regulations and increased pressure on industry to monitor, measure and reduce its impact. We help industry tackle this challenge with our proprietary biodiversity monitoring technology.

description:
